items.preText: Noon The in-form Tamim Iqbal will open with Anamul. It is difficult to say if Anamul is in form or not. He has played some imperious shots but hasn't built on starts in this series. Lakmal has the new ball for the visitors. He runs in from over the wicket 11.50am Kawsar: "Why Abul?? I feel BD missed a trick by not giving Saifuddin another match. BD really need a pace bowling alrounder if they are to compete in outside Asia." 11.35am Bangladesh win the toss and choose to bat first. Abul Hasan comes in place of Sunzamul Islam. Sri Lanka bring in Danushka Gunathilaka for the injured Kusal Perera. They have made another change on the bowling front: Chameera replaces Praeep Mashrafe: We will like to bat first. The wicket has become slower, and dew will come in. Our middle order has to step up. The way Tamim and Shakib are batting is good for us. Chandimal: You can't control the toss, but this is a must-win game for us. Injuries are the main concern for us in the last one or two years. We've got players but we miss the seniors. Nuwan Pradeep has a hamstring strain and Kusal Perera has a side strain. Sri Lanka: Tharanga, Gunathilaka, Mendis, Chandimal (capt.), Gunaratne, Dickwella(wk), Perera, Lakmal, Sandakan, Dananjaya, Chameera Bangladesh: Tamim, Anamul, Shakib, Mushfiqur (wk), Mahmudullah, Sabbir, Nasir, Mashrafe (capt.), Abul Hasan, Mustafizur, Rubel Randheer: "Bangladesh's rise to the top has been amazing.They have a good core around Tamim,Shakib and Rahim in their batting unit and the likes of Mortaza's experience in the bowling unit is important for B'desh to cash in " --- Indeed, Bangladesh's seniors are boosting their side. Sri Lanka's not so much Ravindra: "Fitness of players are also hurting SL team's performance. Best performers are getting injured immediately." --- Kusal Perera has joined Angelo Mathews on the injury list. Dhananjaya de Silva has been called in as a replacement saiful-BD: "As a BD fan, I don't think BD are that good enough a team to rest both the captain and most economical bowler in the tournament so far in the same match. Its against Sri Lanka who, although out of form, are still a team you need to watch out for. Anamul's omission shouldn't occur after only 3 games either, particularly when he has batted according to the team's wants." 11.20am Welcome to ESPNcricinfo's live ball-by-ball coverage of the sixth match of the tri-series. Bangladesh have already qualified for the final after three successive bonus-point wins. So slim is the net run rate difference between Zimbabwe (-1.087) and Sri Lanka (-0.989) that Chandimal's men need to win. There is a chance Sri Lanka can also qualify is they lose very narrowly. Andrew Fernando sets up the scene in the preview. Kusal: "I bet this is a crucial toss here, SL's chasing record hasn't been great at all in recent past. Fingers crossed. win toss, bat first." Safin: "Expecting a crushing match today, 12:25 ESt here in NYC, took day off tomorrow to watch the entire match. Very excited!" Tamim Sarker: "I would like to see some changes in this match for Bd. rest Fizz and Mash and try Mithun in place of Anamul" Nuramva: "It is a game of inches on the field, but mathematically, it is a game of decimals. Thus, unless Sri Lanka implode and perform pretty disastrously, they should be through to the finals. An optimist can view this game as a virtual final."
items.text: pitched up and slanting away outside off, Tamim presses forward, meets the pitch and push-drives through the vacant cover-point region
items.shortText: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, 2 runs

items.text: Lakmal finds late inswing and hits the front pad of Tamim. But it pitched outside the leg stump, and it was perhaps bouncing over the stumps too. The opener was struck above the knee-roll
items.shortText: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: back of a length on off, solidly blocked on the front foot
items.shortText: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: full and nipping away just a shade outside off, Tamim pushes away from the body and watches the ball skip past the outside edge
items.shortText: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: full and angling away wider outside off, Tamim shoulders arms
items.shortText: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: overpitched and outside off, Tamim stretches out but does not middle a drive. Instead, he squeezes the ball through extra cover
items.shortText: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, 2 runs

items.preText: Chameera. Extra pace. Over the wicket
items.text: short, wide, the extra pace works in the batsman favour. Anamul slashes it with all his might but straight to backward point
items.shortText: Chameera to Anamul Haque, no run

items.text: good-length outswinger, starts outside off and nibbles away further. Anamul watches it through to Dickwella
items.shortText: Chameera to Anamul Haque, no run

items.preText: Hashimi Ismail: "This will be a crucial game for Asela Gunaratne. Since his return from his Injury he hasn't performed that well. He is a fan favourite in SL, so a good performance in this match would do great for him!" --- I'm quite a fan of Asela too. Looking forward to his reverse-swats with the bat
items.text: off-stump yorker, which is dug out to the covers
items.shortText: Chameera to Anamul Haque, no run

items.text: back of a length and straying into the hips, does not make contact with a flick but secures a leg bye to square leg
items.shortText: Chameera to Anamul Haque, 1 leg bye

items.text: back of a length, rears up and moves past the outside edge near the higher part of the bat
items.shortText: Chameera to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: full on off, presses forward but does not meet the pitch, winds up squirting an inside edge to the midwicket region
items.shortText: Chameera to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: good length and angling into a forward-defensive to mid-on
items.shortText: Lakmal to Anamul Haque, no run

items.text: Loose, loose shot. Full and wide outside off - possibly on a sixth-stump line - Anamul simply throws his hands at the ball. He has a big swish at it and only manages to drag a thick inside edge back onto the stumps. The leg stump is tilted back. Anamul has a long stare at the bowler, he can't believe what he has done. He has bagged a six-ball duck. The search for a solid opening partner for Tamim continues
items.shortText: Lakmal to Anamul Haque, OUT

items.text: good length and angling away outside off, Shakib takes it on the up and drives it gloriously between the covers and mid-off. Chandimal chases the ball but dives gingerly and early, letting the ball roll away to the boundary
items.shortText: Lakmal to Shakib Al Hasan, FOUR runs

items.text: Lakmal pulls his length back and gets it to slant into off stump, played back to the bowler
items.postText: Iftekhar: "No foot work from Anamul and he paid the price."
items.shortText: Lakmal to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: another glorious drive from Shakib. Whoa! Pitched up just a shade outside off, caressed in the gap between covers and mid-off again
items.shortText: Lakmal to Shakib Al Hasan, FOUR runs

items.preText: A straight silly mid-off in place now
items.text: good length and outside off, punched on the up to backward point
items.postText: Ammar J: "Two strong and in-form batsmen on the pitch now. Oh man Sri Lanka need to break this partnership early between Shakib and Tamim!"
items.shortText: Lakmal to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: short of a good length and angling away wide outside off, left alone, off-side wide
items.shortText: Chameera to Tamim Iqbal, 1 wide

items.text: pitched up on off stump, forward and driven straight to mid-off
items.shortText: Chameera to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.preText: TareQ: "Thats not Good for Anamul, He gets that chance after lots of struggles and this is not the way to utilize a Big opportunity. "
items.text: full and angling across off, Tamim plays away from the body, carving a drive to square-ish third man
items.shortText: Chameera to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.text: bouncer on the leg stump, the speed gun says 130ks, but I bet that's a lot quicker. Shakib ducks and the ball soars to Dickwella
items.shortText: Chameera to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: back of a length and outside off, nearly 140ks, but stops the batsman, Shakib spoons a drive in front of mid-off
items.shortText: Chameera to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.preText: SarfBD: "Why can't these batsmen be more patient? They should just try to middle the ball, gain some confidence, have a feel. Then go for run. Really disappointed with Anamul."
items.text: back of a length on off, Chameera hits the bat hard and draws a push to mid-off
items.shortText: Chameera to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: 136.2ks bouncer on middle, Shakib has his eyes locked on the ball before sinking under it
items.shortText: Chameera to Shakib Al Hasan, no run
